page.title: 03STAFFS POLICE MOUNTED BRANCH
page.content: The horses have to be 3 years old before they are trained. If they are fit they work to the age of twenty. The policemen take it in turns to look after the horses. It costs 1,000 pounds a year to feed one horse. There are twelve horses altogether at the Staffs Police HQ.. The horses come from all over the country and they are mostly three-quarters Irish bred hunters. The horses are always big ,at present the biggest is 17.2 hands. The Staffs Police Force have been using horses for 120 years. The policemen use the horses for duty at football matches, demonstrations and public fetes. They patrol Cannock Chase every day and give the Chase particular attention during the Summer months and in December when poaching of animals, and theft of Christmas Trees occurs.
